column2: Hooptober Ocho: The Only Way to Stop a Bad Guy with a Chainsaw is a Good Guy with a Chainsaw
column5:
This is my second Hooptober, and I'm pretty excited after last year. For details read Cinemonster's Hooptober Ocho: The Only Way to Stop a Bad Guy with a Chainsaw is a Good Guy with a Chainsaw. As usual, I have my own stipulations on top of the rules.
1) I'd like to keep it to movies I haven't already seen, and 2) Due to changing availability of some films on streaming services, I might have to swap one or more out for something else.
This year's reviews:
1. Dracula Review: â™¥ 2. The Mummy Review: â™¥ 3. The Beyond Review: â™¥ 4. Kill List Review: â™¥ 5. Dead & Buried Review: â™¥
Hooptober Ocho Rules: - 6 countries
- USA: Lots of them - UK: Dracula, The Mummy - Philippines: Pagpag Nine Lives - Japan: Kuroneko - Korea: The 8th Night - France: The Swarm - Italy: The Beyond, The Black Cat - Poland: Nobody Sleeps in the Woods Tonight
- 8 decades
- 1930s: King Kong - 1950s: Dracula, The Mummy - 1960s: Kuroneko, Witchfinder General - 1980s: Films from 1981 below - 1990s: Def by Temptation, Demon Knight - 2000s: Bones - 2010s: Kill list - 2020s: The 8th Night, The Swarm, Nobody Sleeps in the Woods Tonight, etc.
- 2 folk horror
- Kuroneko - Kill List
- 4 films from 1981
- The Funhouse - The Beyond - An American Werewolf in London - The Black Cat - Dead & Buried
- 2 films from your birth year
- Same as 1981 ðŸŽ‚
- 2 haunted house films
- House on Haunted Hill - The Beyond
- The worst Part 2 that you haven't seen and can access. (I realize that this will take a little work)
- Sleepaway Camp II: Unhappy Campers
- 1 film set in the woods
- Nobody Sleeps in the Woods Tonight - Sleepaway Camp II: Unhappy Campers
- 1 Kaiju or Kong film (not the new K v. G)
- King Kong (1933)
- 2 Hammer films
- Dracula - The Mummy
- 3 films with a person of color as director or lead. (excluding Asian)
- Def by Temptation - Bones - Tales from the Crypt: Demon Knight
- 3 Asian horror films.
- Kuroneko - The 8th Night - Pagpag: Nine Lives
And 1 Tobe Hooper Films (There must ALWAYS be a Hooper film)
- The Funhouse
***FOR THOSE THAT LIKE TO DO EXTRA WORK: WATCH JD's Revenge, The Skull and The Scooby Doo Project -review them all.(eek)
